qas.question: What were white Democratic paramilitary groups in Charleston known as?
What granted Freeman were American citizenship?
The Cainhoy Incident occurred on what day?
The violent 1876 incident that took place on King's street happened on what day?
Who won the 1876 election as a result of voter intimidation?
What weren't white Democratic paramilitary groups in Charleston known as?
What granted Freeman weren't American citizenship?
The Cainboy Incident occurred on what day?
The violent 1867 incident that took place on King's street happened on what day?
Who won the 1867 election as a result of voter intimidation?

context: Violent incidents occurred throughout the Piedmont of the state as white insurgents struggled to maintain white supremacy in the face of social changes after the war and granting of citizenship to freedmen by <a1_0><b6_0>federal constitutional amendments<b6_0/>.<a1_0/> After former Confederates were allowed to vote again, election campaigns from 1872 on were marked by violent intimidation of blacks and Republicans by white Democratic paramilitary groups, known as <a0_0><b5_0>the Red Shirts<b5_0/><a0_0/>. Violent incidents took place in Charleston on King Street in <a3_0><b8_0>September 6<b8_0/><a3_0/> and in nearby Cainhoy on <a2_0><b7_0>October 15<b7_0/><a2_0/>, both in association with political meetings before the 1876 election. The Cainhoy incident was the only one statewide in which more whites were killed than blacks. The Red Shirts were instrumental in suppressing the black Republican vote in some areas in 1876 and narrowly electing <a4_0><b9_0>Wade Hampton<b9_0/><a4_0/> as governor, and taking back control of the state legislature. Another riot occurred in Charleston the day after the election, when a prominent Republican leader was mistakenly reported killed.
